intro: Adenia huillensis, commonly known as the Huillé Adenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Passifloraceae, which includes over 500 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, large heart-shaped leaves, and clusters of small, showy flowers. It produces edible fruits that are typically consumed raw or cooked. Adenia huillensis plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing food for various animals and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
